tuv.seg: Some people take early retirement in order to take up another job or to become self-employed
Éiríonn roinnt daoine as a bpost go luath chun post eile a ghlacadh nó chun a bheith féin-fhostaithe
Many people aged over the "normal"retirement age are employed
Tá go leor daoine thar an "gnáthaois" phinsin fostaithe
There are a small number of occupations that have statutory upper age limits but, in general, there is no rule which prevents people over the age of 65 from being employed or self-employed
Tá roinnt bheag slite beatha go bhfuil uasteorainn aoise ag baint leo, ach, go ginearálta, níl aon riail ann a chuireann cosc ar dhaoine thar 65 bliain d'aois a bheith fostaithe nó féinfhostaithe
Many self-employed people continue to be so well past the "normal" retirement age
Bíonn roinnt mhaith daoine féinfhostaithe a leanann ag obair go maith thar an "gnáthaois" phinsin
If you were a permanent and pensionable public servant, your pension may be abated if you go back to work in the public sector
Má bhí tú i do státsheirbhíseach buan agus inphinseanaithe, d'fhéadfadh sé go dtiocfadh maolú ar do phinsean má théann tú ar ais ag obair san earnáil phoiblí
It is generally not possible to further contribute to an occupational pension scheme after the normal age of retirement
Is iondúil nach féidir tuilleadh íocaíochtaí a dhéanamh i scéim pinsin cheirde tar éis an gnáthaois phinsin
In general, there is no upper age limit for employment and there is no single fixed retirement age for employees
Go hiondúil, níl aon uasteorainn aoise i gceist le haghaidh fostaíochta agus níl aon aois le dhul amach ar phinsean
If you are employed, your retirement age is set out in your contract of employment
Má tá tú fostaithe, tá an aois le dhul amach ar phinsean leagtha síos i do chonradh fostaíochta
Some contracts of employment have a mandatory retirement age (that is, the age at which you must retire), but they also have provisions for earlier retirement generally and/or on grounds of illness
I bhformhór conarthaí tá aois shainordaithe le dhul amach ar phinsean leagtha síos sa chonradh - ach is iondúil go mbíonn soláthar ann chun dul amach ar phinsean níos luaithe agus/nó ar bhonn tinneas
The usual retirement age in contracts of employment is 65
Sé an gnáth aois a bhíonn leagtha síos i gconradh le dhul amach ar phinsean ná 65
Many have provisions for early retirement from age 60 or from age 55 and most have provision for early retirement on health grounds
Bíonn soláthar i roinnt mhaith acu le dhul amach ar phinsean go luath ó aois 60 nó aois 55 agus tá socruithe ag formhór acu i gcomhair dul ar phinsean luath mar gheall ar chúrsaí sláinte
In some cases, there is a statutory retirement age. These retirement ages arise in jobs that are established by law and the law sets out the maximum age of staff
I roinnt postanna, tá aois reachtúil ann le n-éirí as an bpost - tárlaíonn sé i bpostanna atá bunaithe ag an dlí agus leagann an dlí síos an uas-aois don fhoireann oibre
If your contract of employment includes a mandatory upper age limit, then you must retire when you reach that limit
Má tá uasteorainn aoise i do chonradh fostaíochta, caithfidh tú éirí as an bpost nuair a shroicheann tú an teorainn sin
However, it is open to you and your employer to negotiate another contract
Is féidir leatsa agus do fhostóir conradh eile a dhéanamh, áfach
If you are subject to a statutory or mandatory retirement age in your job, there is nothing to prevent you taking up a different job when you retire or taking up self-employment
Má tá uasteorainn aoise scoir reachtúla nó sainordaithe i do phost, níl aon chosc ort post eile a ghlacadh nó a bheith féinfhostaithe tar éis duit éirí as an bpost seo
Effect on social welfare payments
Tionchar ar íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh

If you are receiving any social welfare payment other than the State Pension (Contributory) or Widow's, Widower's or Surviving Civil Partner's (Contributory) Pension, working will affect your entitlement

Má tá tú ag fáil aon íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh taobh amuigh den Phinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) nó Phinsean Baintrí, Baintrí Fir nó Páirtnéara Shibhialta Mharthanaigh (Ranníocach) beidh tionchar aige orthu seo má bhíonn tú ag obair
Jobseeker's Benefit or Allowance
Sochar nó Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist
It may be possible to do some part-time work and retain entitlement to part of your Jobseeker's Benefit or Jobseeker's Allowance
B'fhéidir go bhféadfá roinnt oibre páirtaimseartha a dhéanamh agus fós a bheith i dteideal cuid den Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist nó Liúntas Cuardaitheora Poist
If you are getting Pre-Retirement Allowance it may be possible to do some work and retain some entitlement
Má fhaigheann tú Liúntas Réamh Scoir, b'fhéidir go bhféadfá roinnt oibre a dhéanamh agus fós a bheith i dteideal cuid den liúntas
If you are receiving the State Pension (Contributory), you may work or be self-employed without affecting your entitlement
Má tá an Pinsean Stáit (Rannioch) dhá íoc leat is féidir leat a bheith fostaithe nó féinfhostaithe gan aon tionchar a bheith aige seo ar an bpinsean
However, any increase for a qualified adult may be affected if your spouse, civil partner or cohabitant works
Áfach, má oibríonn do chéile, páirtnéir sibhialta nó chomhchónaitheoir, d’fhéadfadh go bhfuil tionchar ar aon mhéadú do dhuine fásta cáilithe
If you are receiving an occupational pension, then you may also work or be self-employed and if you are receiving a private sector pension, working or being self-employed does not usually affect it

Má tá pinsean ceirde dhá íoc leat is féidir leat a bheith ag obair nó a bheith féinfhostaithe chomh maith. Má tá pinsean ón earnáil phríobháideach dhá íoc leat go hiondúil ní bhíonn aon tionchar ag aon obair a bheadh agat ar seo
However, most public sector pension schemes are subject to what is called abatement if you return to work in the public sector
Ach, tá maolú i gceist le formhór na scéimeanna pinsin san earnáil phoiblí má fhilleann tú ar obair san earnáil phoiblí

The precise conditions may vary from one scheme to another but, in general, abatement means that the pension is reduced in order to ensure that you do not earn more between the pension and the income from employment than you would if you had remained in employment

Ní mar an gcéanna a bhíonn na coinníollacha sna scéimeanna seo, ach go ginearálta ciallaíonn an maolú seo go laghdófar do phinsean chun a chinntiú nach bhfuil tú ag fáil níos mó ón bpinsean agus an t-ioncam ón bhfostaíocht ná a mbeifeá ag saothrú dá mbeifeá fós sa phost óna bhfuil tú ag fáil an phinsin
If you are getting a public service pension and you go to work in the private sector, your pension is not affected
Má tá tú ag fáil pinsin ón tseirbhís phoiblí agus go dtéann tú ag obair san earnáil phríobháideach, níl aon tionchar aige seo ar do phinsean
Contributions to occupational pensions
Ranníocaíochtaí le scéimeanna pinsin cheirde
If you are employed, you may contribute to the new employment pension scheme if you are eligible
Má tá tú fostaithe, is féidir leat ranníocaíochtaí a dhéanamh don scéim nua pinsin má tá tú i dteideal seo a dhéanamh
Most occupational pension schemes do not cater for contributions over the age of 65 but it is possible that some do
Ní bhíonn aon réiteach ag formhór na scéimeanna pinsin cheirde i gcomhair ranníocaíochtaí thar aois 65, ach d'fhéadfadh sé go mbeadh ag roinnt acu
It is possible to get tax relief on contributions up to age 70
Is féidir faoiseamh cánach a fháil ar íocaíochtaí suas go dtí 70 bliain d'aois
If you are self-employed or your new employment does not include an occupational pension, you could decide to make arrangements for a personal pension
Má tá tú féinfhostaithe nó muna bhfuil scéim pinsin cheirde ag baint le do fhostaíocht nua, d'fhéadfá socruithe a dhéanamh i gcomhair pinsin phearsanta
Again, the upper age limit for tax relief for such contributions is 70
Arís, tá faoiseamh cánach ar fáil ar na ranníocaíochtaí seo suas go dtí 70 bliain d'aois
Most legislation dealing with the protection of employees does not have an upper age limit
Ní bhaineann aois teorainn leis an gcuid is mó den reachtú a bhaineann le cosaint fhostaithe
So, if you are an older worker, whether full or part-time, you are covered by protective legislation dealing with the following areas:
Mar sin, más oibrí níos sine tú, is cuma páirt nó lánaimseartha, tá tú clúdaithe ag reachtú a bhaineann leo seo a leanas:
• Information about your terms and conditions of employment
• Eolas maidir le do thearmaí agus coinníollacha oibre
• Maximum working hours, rest periods, Sunday working, night working
• Uasmhéid uaireanta oibre, tréimhsí scíth, obair Dhomhnaigh, obair oíche
• Health and safety at work
• Sláinte agus sábhailteacht ag an obair
• Minimum notice - the amount of notice is related to the length of service
• Fógra scoir - tá an méid fógra atá sé de cheart agat a fháil ag brath ar an fhad atá tú ag obair ann
If you lose your job and your employer owes you money for arrears of pay, holidays and a number of other items, you may claim this from the Social Insurance Fund
Má chailleann tú do phost agus go bhfuil airgead ag dul ag d'fhostóir duit ar phá, saoire agus roinnt nithe eile, is féidir leat an t-airgead seo a éileamh ón gCiste Árachais Shóisialaigh
Under the Unfair Dismissals Acts, dismissal on the grounds of age is unfair with certain exceptions
Faoin Acht um Bhriseadh Éagórach, is féidir le dífhostú ar bhonn aoise a bheith éagórach
People who must leave employment when they reach the retirement age stated in their contract may not claim unfair dismissal
Ní féidir le daoine a bhfuil orthu an fhostaíocht a fhágáil nuair a shroicheann siad aois an phinsin sainordaithe éileamh a dhéanamh mar gheall ar bhriseadh éagórach
If you are unfairly dismissed, at whatever age, you may complain to the Workplace Relations Commission using the online complaint form available on workplacerelations.ie

Mar sin, má go mbristear go héagórach tú as do phost, is féidir leat gearán a dhéanamh chuig an gCoimisiúin um Chaidreamh san Áit Oibre tríd an fhoirm ghearáin ar líne a úsáid á fáil ar workplacerelations.ie
If you are made redundant you may be entitled to a redundancy payment
Má tugadh iomarcaíocht duit féadann tú a bheith i dteideal iomarcaíocht a fháil
The Employment Equality Acts 1998-2015 prohibit discrimination on 9 grounds including that of age (with certain exceptions)
Cuireann na hAchtanna um Chomhionannas Fostaíochta 1998-2015 cosc ar leatrom a dhéanamh i gcúrsaí fostaíochta ar 9 chúinsí faoi leith, aois san áireamh (tá roinnt eisceachtaí ann)
They apply to all ages above the age a person is statutorily obliged to go to school (16 currently)
Baineann an tAcht, áfach, le daoine atá os cionn aois 16
You can read more in our document, Age equality in employment
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise inár ndoiciméad, Comhionannas aoise san fhostaíocht
If you are aged under 66 and you are employed or self-employed, you are liable to pay PRSI in the normal way. This applies regardless of what you did earlier
Má tá tú faoi 66 bliain d'aois agus fostaithe nó féinfhostaithe, tá dliteanas ort ÁSPC a íoc sa ghnáthbhealach.Tá sé seo i gceist is cuma céard a rinne tú roimhe seo
For example, if you are a former public servant and you take up a job in the private sector, you have to pay full PRSI
Mar shampla, más iar-státsheirbhíseach tú agus go nglacann tú post sa rannóg phríobháideach, caithfidh tú láníocaíochtaí ÁSPC a dhéanamh
In these circumstances, you may be able to qualify for a pro-rata old age contributory pension
Sa chás seo, d'fhéadfadh sé go gcáileófá don phinsean ranníocaíochta seanaoise pro-rata
You only pay PRSI on your income from employment or self-employment
Ní íocann tú ÁSPC ach amháin ar d'ioncam ó fhostaíocht nó féinfhostaíocht
You do not have to pay PRSI on your pension from a former employment
Ní chaithfidh tú ÁSPC a íoc ar do phinsean ó fhostaíocht a bhí agat cheana
If you take up part-time work or low paid work, you are still in the PRSI system but you may not have to pay anything
Má dhéanann tú obair pháirtaimseartha nó obair ar phá íseal beidh tú fós sa chóras ÁSPC ach ní gá go mbeidh ort tada a íoc
If you earn less than €352 a week, you don't have to pay PRSI
Má thuilleann tú níos lú ná €352 sa tseachtain níl aon ÁSPC le n-íoc agat
If you earn over €38, your employer has to pay and you have full cover
Má thuilleann tú ós cionn €38 ní mór don fhostóir íoc ar do shon agus tá lánchlúdach agat
Once you step over the €352 limit, you have to pay on all your income from work
Nuair a thuilleann tú ós cionn €352 sa tseachtain bíonn ort íoc ar d’ioncam
A new PRSI credit was introduced in 2016 which reduces the amount of PRSI payable for people earning between €352.01 and €424 per week
Tháinig creidmheas ÁSPC nua isteach i 2016. Laghdaíonn sé an méid ÁSPC iníoctha ag daoine a thuilleann idir €352.01 agus €424 sa tseachtain
The credit is tapered and the amount of the credit depends on your earnings
Barrchaolaíonn an creidmheas agus braitheann an creidmheas ar do thuilleamh
You are not liable for PRSI contributions after the age of 66 - this is the case whether or not you are employed or self-employed
Níl dliteanas ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC ort tar éis aois 66 – tá sé seo amhlaidh is cuma an fostaithe nó féin-fhostaithe atá tú
If you do not have enough contributions at age 66, you cannot add to them after that
Muna bhfuil dóthain íocaíochtaí agat ag aois 66, ní féidir leat cur leo ina dhiaidh sin
Unlike some occupational pension arrangements, there is no facility to retrospectively pay PRSI contributions
Níl aon deis agat íocaíochtaí ÁSPC a íoc go siarghábhálach, deis atá ar fáil áfach i gcuid de na scéimeanna pinsin cheirde
If you are aged 66 and in employment, your employer pays a small PRSI contribution to cover you for occupational injuries
Má tá tú 66 bliain d'aois agus fostaithe, íocann d'fhostóir ranníocaíocht bheag ÁSPC chun clúdach a chur ar fáil do ghortú ceirde
This is called Class J social insurance
Tugtar árachas sóisialta Aicme J air seo
You pay the Universal Social Charge (USC) if your gross income is more than €13,000 per year
Íocann tú an Muirear Sóisialta Uilíoch má tá d'ioncam os cionn €13,000 sa bhliain
It does not apply to social welfare or similar payments
Gearrfar é ar an uile ioncam seachas íocaíochtaí leasa sóisialaigh nó íocaíochtaí comhchosúla
Reduced rates of USC apply to people aged 70 or over whose aggregate income for the year is €60,000 or less and to certain medical card holders under 70
Má tá tú 70 bliain d’aois nó níos sine nó más sealbhóir cárta leighis thú agus más ionann do chomhioncam don bhliain agus €60,000 nó níos lú, íocann tú ráta laghdaithe den MSU
Income tax applies to almost all income
Baineann cáin ioncaim le nach mór chuile ioncam
People aged 65 and over are subject to the same general tax rules as everyone else but they do get tax exemption limits below which they pay no tax and some extra tax credits
Má tá tú 65 nó ós a chionn, ní mór duit cáin a íoc ar ioncam ar an gnáthbhealach. Ach tá na teorainneacha díolúine i bhfad níos airde agus tá creidmheasanna cánacha sa bhreis ar fáil duit
There are specific tax arrangements for people aged over 65 including the taxation of occupational pensions and the taxation of social welfare payments
Tá cur síos ar na socruithe cánacha a bhaineann le daoine atá os cionn 65 lena n-áirítear cáin ar phinsin gairme agus gearradh cánach ar íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh
